message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we first factor out the common terms in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator:
4x^2 - 6x = 2x(2x - 3)

Denominator:
2x^2 - 8x = 2x(x - 4)

Now, substitute the factored expressions back into the rational expression:

(2x(2x - 3)) / (2x(x - 4))

Since there is a common factor of 2x in both the numerator and the denominator, we can cancel it out:

(2x - 3) / (x - 4)

The simplified rational expression is:

(2x - 3) / (x - 4)
